cold_snaps.status: There is not an active cold snap.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 3.7.

extreme.status: The highest recorded temperature difference is 26.7°C from 29 April 2025 (when the temperature reached 27.1°C but fell to 0.4°C).

heatwave.status: There is currently no heatwave.  This year there have been 6 heatwaves, usually there are 1.9 heatwaves per year.

heaviest_rainfall.status: 36.8mm of rain was recorded as having fallen on 04 January 2025, marking an exceptional 37.2 hour precipitation event.  At times the rain was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: Today, the rain fell at an intense rate peaking at 16.6mm per hour, one of the heaviest downpours recorded and ranked 2nd from our records.  The precipitation lasted 3.2 hours and dumped 5.69mm in total.  27.0mm per hour was the maximum rain rate recorded on 02 September 2025, during a 15.0 hour storm which dumped 21.19mm of rain from the clouds.

storm.status: On 04 January 2025, the rain lasted for 37.2 hours, which is the longest time recorded by our database.  36.8mm accumulated and it fell at 4.6mm per hour at times.
An active storm has been detected in the vicinity.  The last storm we experienced was on 03 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: We are in the midst of one of the longest rainy periods recorded.  This rainy period is ranked 4th since records began in August 2024.  The current stretch started on 26 August 2025 and has lasted 10 days.  The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

tropical: The last observed tropical night was 18 July 2025, making a total of only 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current wind direction is southerly (191°), which is about average.  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The record wind gust remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

run.status: The largest wind run ever was on 21 October 2012 with a value of 1754 miles.  The long-term average wind run is 229.41 miles and so far today the wind run is 66.76 miles.

speed.status: The highest wind speed ever seen was 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 5.0°C) and outside temperature (down 3.2°C) and drier conditions in rainfall (down 0.8 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in pressure (down 7 mbar), light levels (up 7632 lux), cloud levels (up 130 m), and rainfall (up 0.8 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in light levels (up 11042 lux), cloud levels (up 1600 m), and rainfall (down 0.4 mm) when compared to today.

summary.summary: Inside; a mild and comfortable temperature is anticipated. Outside; pleasant, mild temperatures. Also, air will feel comfortable and balanced and near calm conditions. Rain showers likely, the sky may alternate between sunny and overcast, and a mix of sun and clouds. Changeable conditions.
